name: 600.1 - Method Statement Development / Job Safety Analysis / Enviro Site Specific Plans
Minimum Test Frequency - Prior to Construction
Acceptance Criteria - Method Statement and JSEA Completed and signed by relevant authority
Minimum Test Frequency - Prior to Construction
Acceptance Criteria - DWG’s and Specifications are of For Construction and latest revision. Reviewed and approved by Designer and Client.
Minimum Test Frequency - Prior to Construction
Acceptance Criteria - Set out as per latest Design Model / For Construction Drawings.
Detail of Activity - Submit testing data fir the following materials: - AP65 -GAP 40 -GAP 20 -Hardfill
Minimum Test Frequency - Prior to Construction
Inspection / Test method - Quarry Testing Data
Acceptance Criteria - Material approvals to be sent to the Engineer. Refer Project Specs and Drawings;
○ Weathering Quality Index of A,AB, AC, BA, BB or CA
Minimum Test Frequency - Prior To Construction
Acceptance Criteria - Ensure underground services are positively identified and asbuilt. Where this interferes with design permanent works, Service provider and Designer to be notified immediately.
Detail of Activity - Confirm Pavement Depth
Inspection / Test method - Test Pits / Visual Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Mill 200mm. Dig/core test pits to confirm if existing pavement:
– If existing underlying pavement is of sufficient depth (i.e. ≥250mm below mill surface/≥450mm below finished level), continue with "Existing Pavement" steps below (light green rows).

– If insufficient depth or poor quality, advise WSP Engineer, mill/excavate to 450mm from FL, and complete "Full New Pavement" requirements below (light blue rows for Recycled or Mixed Materials, light yellow rows for Engineered Material only - i.e. AP65,).
Comments - Existing pavement to measure 450mm from finished level (minimum). If not "Full New Pavement" requirements are to be followed.
Minimum Test Frequency - 20m centres, alternating wheel tracks where possible
Acceptance Criteria - Review beam test results to determine if undercuts are required.
Record documents - QC Sheets / Lab Result Sheet
Detail of Activity - Milled Surface Stringlines
Acceptance Criteria - Finished Level – String Line, +20mm/-50mm (i.e. 20mm high, 50mm deep)
Detail of Activity - Mat Samples (1m2 canvas)
Minimum Test Frequency - 1 mat weighed every 400m2
Acceptance Criteria - Subbase to be stabalised with 3% cement.
• Keep record of tonnage of stabilisation agent (cement) used per area 14. kg/m2 +/- 0.5kg/m2.
Detail of Activity - Plateau Density Test
Minimum Test Frequency - 1 Plateau Density Test per lot
Acceptance Criteria - Determine minimum number of roller passes required to reach peak compaction strength using both primary compaction and finishing compaction rollers.
Minimum Test Frequency - Once per lot
Inspection / Test method - Visual Inspection (with tape measure)
Minimum Test Frequency - 20m centres, alternating wheel tracks where possible
Record documents - IANZ Accredited Lab Results
Minimum Test Frequency - Cores (1 per 2000m2, minimum 3 per lot)
Inspection / Test method - Core Visual Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Cohesivity (cores hold together to be removed)
•  Grading of aggregate (i.e. good mix of different stone sizes)
Record documents - QC Sheets (Photos / Coring Report)
Acceptance Criteria - Layer Finished Level – String Line, each lane
600.15 - Full Depth New Pavement - Recycled/Mixed Material - Subgrade Layer
Acceptance Criteria - Cut subgrade to 450mm below finished level.
• String line tolerance to be within +20mm/-50mm (i.e. 20mm high, 50mm deep)
Comments - Remove to waste and excavate 530mm from top of kerb / 450mm from finished surface level.
600.16 - Full Depth New Pavement - Recycled/Mixed Material - Subgrade Layer
Minimum Test Frequency - Inferred CBR, 5 tests per 500m2. 1 per 20lm
Acceptance Criteria - Scala (bearing Strength on insitu subgrade) to depth 500mm, with the following requirement to be achieved;
Comments - Scala results to meet or exceed per below:
600.17 - Full Depth New Pavement - Recycled/Mixed Material - Subgrade Layer
Minimum Test Frequency - One per lot
Acceptance Criteria - Proof roll – Check for uniformity, soft areas to be undercut
• 200mm and backfilled with recycled pavement, AP40 Hardfill or AP65.
Comments - Backfilled with recycled pavement (millings), Hardfill or AP65.
600.18 - Full Depth New Pavement - Recycled/Mixed Material - Subgrade Improvement Layer
Minimum Test Frequency - Every undercut section
Acceptance Criteria - Measure and record undercut area and depth
600.19 - Full Depth New Pavement - Recycled/Mixed Material - Subgrade Improvement Layer
Acceptance Criteria - Backfill and compact in 160mm-200mm layers
Comments - Use recycled pavement (millings), Hardfill or AP65 if available.

• We propose to use proof roll instead of NDM testing because of the variablity of the recycled material and the bitumen content in it making it hard to test. This supersedes clause 22.2.1 in the project Specification.
600.20 - Full Depth New Pavement - Recycled/Mixed Material - Subbase Layer
Acceptance Criteria - Construct subbase with 200mm of millings and top up with AP65 if needed. (330mm below TOK)
• Add 50mm of 20-40 drainage material. (280mm below TOK)
• Ensure material is compacted and enough volume to be stabilised.
Comments - Check each layer with strings
600.21 - Full Depth New Pavement - Recycled/Mixed Material - Subbase Stabilising (During Construction)
Detail of Activity - Mat Samples (1m2 canvas)
Minimum Test Frequency - 1 mat weighed every 400m2
Acceptance Criteria - Subbase to be stabalised with 3% cement.
• Keep record of tonnage of stabilisation agent (cement) used per area 14. kg/m2 +/- 0.5kg/m2.
600.22 - Full Depth New Pavement - Recycled/Mixed Material - Subbase Stabilising (During Construction)
Detail of Activity - Plateau Density Test
Minimum Test Frequency - 1 Plateau Density Test per lot
Acceptance Criteria - Determine minimum number of roller passes to achieve peak/maximum density using both primary compaction and finishing compaction rollers.
600.23 - Full Depth New Pavement - Recycled/Mixed Material - Subbase Stabilising (During Construction)
Minimum Test Frequency - Once per lot
Inspection / Test method - Visual Inspection (with tape measure)

Minimum Test Frequency - 20m centres, alternating wheel tracks where possible
Record documents - IANZ Accredited Lab Results

Inspection / Test method - Core Visual Inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Cohesivity (cores hold together to be removed)
• Grading of aggregate (i.e. good mix of different stone sizes)
Record documents - QC Sheets (Photos / Coring Report)
600.26 - Full Depth New Pavement - Recycled/Mixed Material - Stabilised Subbase (Post Construction)
Acceptance Criteria - Layer Finished Level – String Line, each lane. Tolerance: +10mm/-30mm
600.27 - Full Depth New Pavement - Engineered Material - Subgrade Layer
Acceptance Criteria - Cut subgrade to 450mm below finished level.
• String line tolerance to be within +20mm/-50mm (i.e. 20mm high, 50mm deep)
Comments - Remove to waste and excavate 530mm from top of kerb / 450mm from finished surface level.

Acceptance Criteria - Scala (bearing Strength on insitu subgrade) to depth 500mm, with the following requirement to be achieved;
Comments - Scala results to meet or exceed per below:
600.29 - Full Depth New Pavement - Engineered Material - Subgrade Layer
Minimum Test Frequency - One per lot
Acceptance Criteria - Proof roll – Check for uniformity, soft areas to be undercut 200mm and backfilled with recycled pavement, AP40 Hardfill or AP65.
Comments - Backfilled with recycled pavement (millings), Hardfill or AP65.
600.30 - Full Depth New Pavement - Engineered/Quarry/AP65 Material - Subgrade Improvement Layer
Minimum Test Frequency - Every undercut section
Acceptance Criteria - Measure and record undercut area and depth
600.31 - Full Depth New Pavement - Engineered/Quarry/AP65 Material - Subgrade Improvement Layer
Acceptance Criteria - Backfill and compact in 160mm-200mm layers
600.32 - Full New Pavement - Engineered/Quarry/AP65 Material - Subbase Stabilising (During Construction)
Detail of Activity - MDD and OWC
Minimum Test Frequency - MDD and OWC 1 test per 5000m² laid
Record documents - IANZ Accredited Lab Results
600.33 - Full New Pavement - Engineered/Quarry/AP65 Material - Subbase Stabilising (During Construction)
Detail of Activity - Mat Samples (1m2 canvas)
Minimum Test Frequency - 1 mat weighed every 400m2
Acceptance Criteria - Subbase to be stabalised with 3% cement.
• Keep record of tonnage of stabilisation agent (cement) used per area 14. kg/m2 +/- 0.5kg/m2.
600.34 - Full New Pavement - Engineered/Quarry/AP65 Material - Subbase Stabilising (During Construction)
Detail of Activity - Plateau Density Test
Minimum Test Frequency - 1 Plateau Density Test per lot (take samples from behind stabiliser as required - min 3 - for lab testing to determine moisture correction)

Acceptance Criteria - Determine minimum number of roller passes required to meet 95% MDD using both primary compaction and finishing compaction rollers. Report values. Used for moisture contect correction
600.35 - Full New Pavement - Engineered/Quarry/AP65 Material - Subbase Stabilising (During Construction)

Detail of Activity - Indirect Tensile Strength (ITS)
Minimum Test Frequency - Two (2) soaked & two (2) dry ITS - taken by IANZ accredited lab technician behind hoe
Record documents - IANZ Accredited Lab Results

Minimum Test Frequency - Direct Transmission NDM (1 per 200m2)
Acceptance Criteria - Tests to be completed at 100mm depth increments starting at 200mm depth. Check for consistency/uniformity in test results.
